partial_orders.reason: Both edits are making identical structural changes to getattr() calls within the same method (_get_parent_attribute). Edit 0 changes 'getattr(self._role, attr)' to 'getattr(self._role, attr, None)' and edit 1 changes 'getattr(dep, attr)' to 'getattr(dep, attr, None)'. This represents a uniform substitution pattern where the same before→after transformation (adding None as default parameter to getattr calls) is being applied to the same type of syntactic construct (getattr function calls) within the same function. Both edits are part of a single refactoring task to add safe defaults to getattr calls, making them bi-directional neighbours in mental flow.

Each edit adds a `hasattr` check and modifies the `getattr` call to include a `None` default parameter. The pattern is: adding `and hasattr(obj, attr)` to the condition and changing `getattr(obj, attr)` to `getattr(obj, attr, None)`. This is a uniform, synchronized substitution of identical before→after patterns on the same type of syntactic construct (conditional statements with getattr calls). Both edits are clearly part of a single, contiguous refactor to add defensive programming checks.
